sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: The next morning, Will gets up late showing that he was exhausted last night and maybe because it’s been a while since he had a good rest, he feels a little refreshed.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: He then thinks he is late for work but then realizes that it’s Saturday.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Will takes a bath and then goes to the orphanage kitchen, he sees Tims, Chloe and some of the orphanage caretakers are preparing lunches for the children.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: Oh William, looks like you are finally awake.

sentences.name: Tims
sentences.sentence: Looks like you have a good rest, you look like shit yesterday bro.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: Tims, mind your manners. What if the children heard you.

sentences.name: Tims
sentences.sentence: Ehh. . .  fine Chloe, anyway if you have nothing to do. Come helps us out Will

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Sure. . .

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Will helps since he has nothing to do.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Afterwards they had lunch with the children and it was free time in the orphanage until the afternoon classes.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Since it’s free time Will is walking around the orphanage with no purpose in mind until Tims hugs his shoulder from behind.

sentences.name: Tims
sentences.sentence: So what happened last night Will? Like a ghost, you suddenly show up like that. . . I haven't heard from you since. . . you know. . .

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Nothing tims. I was just tired.

sentences.name: Tims
sentences.sentence: I’m just worried about you man. You know you can always talk to me right?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: I know. . .

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Their short reunion was interrupted by a bell that means break time is over.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Tims is a teacher and helps teach the children extra classes on Saturday.

sentences.name: Tims
sentences.sentence: Aw shoot. . . that’s my cue to teach those rascals. They are even more troublesome than us back then, you know. Let’s talk again later, ok?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Ok. Don’t be too hard on them now.

sentences.name: Tims
sentences.sentence: Haha, I’ll try. Anyway, catch you later.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Tims then goes to teach the children, Will watches Tims class for a bit outside. It seems he is well liked by the orphanage children.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Will smiles a little then walks away, he walks around the orphanage and visits the orphanage library.
